title: Error using `const_format_args` in const context

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#![feature(const_format_args)]

const fn my_const_fn(msg: &'static str) {
    let _  = const_format_args!("{}", msg);
    //panic!("{}", msg);
}

fn main() {
    my_const_fn("msg");
}
```

I expected to see this happen: The [documentation for `const_format_args`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/macro.const_format_args.html) points out that it's used for the `const_panic` feature. So I was expecting the above program to compile.

Instead, this happened:
```
$ rustc test.rs 
error[E0015]: cannot call non-const formatting macro in constant functions
 --> test.rs:4:39
  |
4 |     let _  = const_format_args!("{}", msg);
  |                                       ^^^
  |
  = note: calls in constant functions are limited to constant functions, tuple structs and tuple variants
  = note: this error originates in the macro `const_format_args` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

note: erroneous constant used
 --> test.rs:4:33
  |
4 |     let _  = const_format_args!("{}", msg);
  |                                 ^^^^

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0015`.
```
The program compiles if I replace the `const_format_args` line with the commented `panic` line. Is this expected?
